page.title: 01Swannington and Alderford
page.content: The landscape consists of a plateau of arable land, broken by shallow valleys cut by two tributaries of the river Wensum. The villages of Swannington, Alderford and Upgate nestle in these valleys. Agriculture is the only industry, employing about 15% of the working population. Social activities in the village centre around the churches. A room at Swannington church is used for parish activities. The church buildings are late Norman and Swannington Hall is a sixteenth century farmhouse which has recently been converted into a restaurant and pub. The riding stables on Upgate common provide a popular amenity.The three village commons , on which some villigers still excercise their right to keep small livestock and collect logs, togethet cover 130 acres.
